pathAssistantSteps.info:
Reminders:


1) Ensure the Start Date and the End Date have been specified. As a best practice, schedule a review session with your extended team after the End Date to review the progress made, whether the Plan Target was attained and what might be needed for the next iteration of the Account Plan.

2) During the course of the account plan timeframe, schedule time with your manager to review the progress with the plan, the current challenges and the necessary changes that may help with the tactical execution (i.e. changes to objectives or actions).

Reminders:


1) Once the timeframe for the Active Account plan has concluded or the Plan Target has been achieved, archive the account plan and create a new plan based on a new Plan Target for the account.

Reminders:


1) Leverage support of Extended Team to analyze & determine financial goal (Plan Target) for your Account. The extended team is anyone who is currently supporting the customer (other Account Managers, ISRs, ISAMs, BSRs, Specialists, Field Support)

2) Assess required timeframe to reach your Plan Target to coincide with timeframe of your Active Account Plan. For example, if it will require 9 months to attain plan target, the Start/End Date for your Account Plan should be set for 9 months      

3) Define the higher-level strategy, key plan objectives & action items required to meet the Plan Target

4) Socialize “Draft” Account Plan with internal stakeholders as needed. This may include Regional Marketing, Sales Leadership, Sales Ops

5) Once the drafting phase is complete, transition your account plan to an “Active” Status, which indicates that the execution of your account plan has started.
